rubbish.translation[0].definitions[0].de: food, paper etc that is no longer needed and has been thrown away
rubbish.translation[0].definitions[0].no: rubbish tip/dump (=a place to take rubbish)
rubbish.translation[0].definitions[1].de: objects, papers etc that you no longer use and should throw away
rubbish.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: I’ve got so much rubbish on my desk it’s unbelievable.
rubbish.translation[0].definitions[2].de: an idea, statement etc that is rubbish is silly or wrong and does not deserve serious attention
rubbish.translation[0].definitions[2].no: rubbish! spoken (=used to tell someone that what they have just said is completely wrong)
rubbish.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a film, book etc that is rubbish is very bad
rubbish.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: things that people throw away, such as old food, dirty paper etc
People are being encouraged to recycle their household rubbish.
the rubbish bin
garbage/trash
The garbage is collected every Tuesday.
There were piles of trash in the backyard.
a black plastic garbage bag
refuse
The strike has disrupted refuse collection.
It’s a site which is used for domestic refuse.
litter
empty bottles, pieces of paper etc that people have dropped on the ground
Parents should teach children not to drop litter.
There was a lot of litter on the beach.
waste
rubbish, or materials that need to be dealt with after they have been used in industrial processes
nuclear waste
toxic waste
household waste
The company was fined for dumping toxic waste in the sea.
rubbish.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to say something is bad or useless
rubbish.translation[2].definitions[0].de: not skilful at a particular activity
